cluster_classes.class_description: Conceptual and theoretical issues surrounding black holes, including their existence, incomplete descriptions, and open mysteries about their properties and behavior.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: They concern theorized existence, unresolved questions, and the need for a more complete description of black holes.

members.entity_description: Theoretical and later accepted notion that black holes are real cosmic entities.
Unresolved questions and unknown aspects surrounding black holes, including currently open scientific problems about their formation, properties, and behavior.
Theoretical account or model explaining black hole properties and internal structure.

cluster_classes.class_description: A written scientific essay focused on black holes, covering their formation, properties, and unresolved mysteries.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: An essay discussing black holes, their formation, properties, and associated scientific mysteries.

members.entity_description: An essay discussing black holes, their formation, properties, and associated scientific mysteries.

args.new_description: Conceptual and theoretical issues surrounding black holes in astrophysics, including their existence, theoretical descriptions, and unresolved mysteries about their properties and behavior.
args.justification: The class clearly represents theoretical and conceptual aspects of black holes within astrophysics; updating the label and assigning a shared Astrophysics – Black Holes class group clarifies scope and connects it to related black hole content.

args.new_description: A written scientific essay focused on black holes in astrophysics, covering their formation, properties, and unresolved mysteries.
args.justification: This class is a document-type entity about black holes; refining the label and assigning the same Astrophysics – Black Holes class group aligns it with the related conceptual class while preserving the distinct document focus.
